Package org.sat4j.tools.counting

Class AbstractApproxMC

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sat4j.tools.counting.AbstractApproxMC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IModelCounter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ApproxMC, ApproxMC2
    public abstract class AbstractApproxMC
extends Object
implements IModelCounter
    The AbstractApproxMC defines the base structure for the various implementations of the ApproxMC algorithm proposed by Chakraborty, Meel and Vardi.
    Author:
    Romain Wallon

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static double DEFAULT_DELTA
      The default DELTA value (confidence) to use as parameter for the algorithm.
      static double DEFAULT_EPSILON
      The default EPSILON value (tolerance) to use as parameter for the algorithm.
      protected double delta
      The DELTA parameter for the algorithm, i.e. the confidence of the count.
      protected double epsilon
      The EPSILON parameter for the algorithm, i.e. the tolerance of the count.
      protected ParityConstraintGenerator generator
      The generator for the parity constraints to add to the solver.
      protected SamplingSet samplingSet
      The set of variables to consider when creating parity constraints.

    • Method Detail

      • countModels

        public final BigInteger countModels()
        Counts an approximation m of the number of models of the underlying formula F. This number verifies (#F / (1 + epsilon) <= m <= (1 + epsilon) #F) with probability (1 - delta). This is a template method, which invokes multiple times internalCountModels(int) so as to get several approximations.
        Specified by:
        countModels in interface IModelCounter
        Returns:
        An approximate count of the number of solutions.
        See Also:
        internalCountModels(int)

      • computeThreshold

        protected abstract int computeThreshold()
        Computes the threshold to apply w.r.t. the tolerance wanted for the algorithm.
        Returns:
        The bound for the number of models to find when invoking the (bounded) SAT oracle.
        See Also:
        boundedSAT(int)

      • computeIterCount

        protected abstract int computeIterCount()
        Computes the number of approximations to make so as to get a number of models that is, with high probability, close to the real number of models.
        Returns:
        The number of iterations to perform.

      • internalCountModels

        protected abstract BigInteger internalCountModels​(int threshold)
        Counts an epsilon-approximate estimate of the model count of the underlying formula, by partitioning the space of all the models into "small" cells containing at most threshold models.
        Parameters:
        threshold - The bound for the number of models in a cell.
        Returns:
        The estimate of the model count, or null to report a counting error, i.e;, when all generated cells were either empty or too big.

      • boundedSAT

        protected final long boundedSAT​(int bound)
        Counts up to bound models of the current formula, by enumerating these models.
        Parameters:
        bound - The maximum number of models to count.
        Returns:
        The number of models that have been found.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: IModelCounter
        Resets this counter. This method only makes sure that counting again the models will return the same results. In particular, none of the original constraints are removed.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface IModelCounter
